data.name: Counting Sort
data.description:
Your task is to implement Counting sort algorithm. What is known about initial array is that all it's members are integers that are greater or equal 0. Mind that it should be faster than O(n*logn) that is provided by Array.prototype.sort.

Brief description of algorithm:

  1. determine min and max values
  2. for each value from min to max count how many times it shows up in array and place corresponding values in another array. for example:
    • array: [3,4,5,4,3,7]
    • counted array: [2,2,1,0,1] (corresponds to [3,4,5,6,7])
  3. From that you can count displacement of every value by getting number of values that are smaller than current:
    4. In an example above
    for '3': (0 numbers are smaller than '3') -> places are 0,1
    for '4': (places of numbers that are smaller) -> places are 2,3
    etc.


    Algorithm itself can be found here
    https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Counting_sort
    or anywhere else on the Internet
    P.S. don't try to commit sth like array.sort() - it's of no use.
